name: parallelio

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: mpi
variants.description: Use mpi to build, otherwise use mpi-serial

description:
The Parallel IO libraries (PIO) are high-level parallel I/O C and
Fortran libraries for applications that need to do netCDF I/O from large
numbers of processors on a HPC system.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description:
Cray's MPICH is a high performance and widely portable implementation of
the Message Passing Interface (MPI) standard.

dependencies.name: mpi-serial
dependencies.description: A single processor implementation of the mpi library.

dependencies.name: netcdf-c
dependencies.description:
NetCDF (network Common Data Form) is a set of software libraries and
machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and
sharing of array-oriented scientific data. This is the C distribution.

dependencies.name: netcdf-fortran
dependencies.description:
NetCDF (network Common Data Form) is a set of software libraries and
machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and
sharing of array-oriented scientific data. This is the Fortran
distribution.

dependencies.name: parallel-netcdf
dependencies.description:
PnetCDF (Parallel netCDF) is a high-performance parallel I/O library for
accessing files in format compatibility with Unidata's NetCDF,
specifically the formats of CDF-1, 2, and 5.

dependent_to.name: mpas-model
dependent_to.description:
The Model for Prediction Across Scales (MPAS) is a collaborative project
for developing atmosphere, ocean and other earth-system simulation
components for use in climate, regional climate and weather studies.

dependent_to.name: esmf
dependent_to.description:
The Earth System Modeling Framework (ESMF) is high-performance, flexible
software infrastructure for building and coupling weather, climate, and
related Earth science applications. The ESMF defines an architecture for
composing complex, coupled modeling systems and includes data structures
and utilities for developing individual models.
